intro: Dorema microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited dorema, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, dry fruits are a distinguishing feature, and it is often found in mountainous areas. Dorema microcarpum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
